creditline: Gift from the collection of Edwin and Barbara Braman
description: painting and stencil design on cream-colored flannel (or velvet?); fruit basket at center; twining blue flowers at left and right edges, salmon-colored flowers at bottom
text: During the early years of the 19th century, many women enjoyed painting pictures on velvet that they could display in their homes. To ensure a pleasing composition, sets of pre-cut stencils were used to create multi-colored pictures.
title: Theorem Painting
